intro: Jasminonerium erythrocarpum, commonly known as the red-fruited jasminoonerium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces distinctive red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
